The state Senate must fully vet this constitutional amendment.

Tell the PA Senate: Do your job!

Marsy’s Law is a state constitutional amendment that undermines the rights of people accused of a crime. And in two legislative sessions, the state Senate hasn’t held a single hearing on the bill. Tell your state senator that this bill deserves a hearing!

TAKE ACTION

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Over the last two months, you’ve heard about Marsy’s Law, a dangerous bill that will amend victims’ rights into the state constitution and simultaneously undermine the due process rights of people accused of a crime.

Did you know that neither the state Senate nor the state House has held a single hearing on this proposal? The bill has been considered in two legislative sessions but hasn’t been vetted in any serious way.

The bill is nearing the end of its legislative journey, but the state Senate still has time to do its job. Tell your state senator that the Senate must have a hearing to vet the issues in Marsy’s Law.

A person who is accused of a crime has constitutional protections because the government is trying to deprive them of their liberty and possibly their life. Marsy's Law undercuts that protection by presuming a crime has occurred before the person has been convicted and by cutting short a person's trial or appeals.

Tell the state Senate, “Do your job,” and hold a hearing on Marsy’s Law.

In liberty,

Elizabeth Randol
Legislative Director, ACLU of Pennsylvania

P.S. Learn more about Marsy’s Law by reading the memo of opposition we sent to the state Senate.
